docs.snippet: At least three major U.S. companies, AT&T Inc, Starwood Hotels & Resorts Worldwide Inc and Marriott International Inc, are seeking to complete deals in Cuba as President Barack Obama prepares to visit Havana, a person familiar with the...
docs.lead_paragraph: At least three major U.S. companies, AT&T Inc, Starwood Hotels & Resorts Worldwide Inc and Marriott International Inc, are seeking to complete deals in Cuba as President Barack Obama prepares to visit Havana, a person familiar with the discussions said on Friday.

headline.main: AT&T, Starwood, Marriott Working on Cuba Deals Ahead of Obama Visit
headline.print_headline: AT&T, Starwood, Marriott Working on Cuba Deals Ahead of Obama Visit

docs.snippet: A cache of leaked documents containing the names of recruits into the Islamic State group includes references to several of the men who carried out the November attacks in Paris, a German broadcaster reported Friday. Security officials and...
docs.lead_paragraph: A cache of leaked documents containing the names of recruits into the Islamic State group includes references to several of the men who carried out the November attacks in Paris, a German broadcaster reported Friday. Security officials and counterterrorism analysts said the cache could provide valuable clues into how the group lures followers and how vast its global recruiting networks are.

headline.main: German Broadcaster: IS Files Refer to Some Paris Attackers
headline.print_headline: German Broadcaster: IS Files Refer to Some Paris Attackers

docs.snippet: Algeria's army said on Friday it had killed three Islamist militants near the eastern city of El Oued and seized a large quantity of weapons including six anti-aircraft missiles.
docs.lead_paragraph: Algeria's army said on Friday it had killed three Islamist militants near the eastern city of El Oued and seized a large quantity of weapons including six anti-aircraft missiles.

headline.main: Algerian Army Kills Suspected Militants, Seizes Missiles
headline.print_headline: Algerian Army Kills Suspected Militants, Seizes Missiles

docs.snippet: Police are investigating whether former Russian Press Minister Mikhail Lesin, who was found dead in a Washington hotel in November, was brutally assaulted before returning to the hotel, a U.S. law enforcement source said on Friday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Police are investigating whether former Russian Press Minister Mikhail Lesin, who was found dead in a Washington hotel in November, was brutally assaulted before returning to the hotel, a U.S. law enforcement source said on Friday.

headline.main: Dead Ex-Russian Press Minister May Have Been Attacked Outside Hotel: Source
headline.print_headline: Dead Ex-Russian Press Minister May Have Been Attacked Outside Hotel: Source

docs.snippet: Syria's main opposition group said it would attend peace talks on Monday but accused the government of President Bashar al-Assad of preparing to escalate the war to strengthen its negotiating position.
docs.lead_paragraph: Syria's main opposition group said it would attend peace talks on Monday but accused the government of President Bashar al-Assad of preparing to escalate the war to strengthen its negotiating position.

headline.main: Syria Opposition to Attend Geneva Peace Talks
headline.print_headline: Syria Opposition to Attend Geneva Peace Talks

docs.snippet: The European Central Bank embarked on a rearguard action to win over skeptical investors on Friday, a day after chief Mario Draghi unveiled a new stimulus package but blunted its impact by suggesting the ECB would not cut interest rates again.
docs.lead_paragraph: The European Central Bank embarked on a rearguard action to win over skeptical investors on Friday, a day after chief Mario Draghi unveiled a new stimulus package but blunted its impact by suggesting the ECB would not cut interest rates again.

headline.main: ECB Defends 'Super Mario' After Investor Backlash
headline.print_headline: ECB Defends 'Super Mario' After Investor Backlash

docs.snippet: Italy's top appeals court has rejected an attempt to overthrow a verdict that last year acquitted former UniCredit head Alessandro Profumo and 19 other bank managers in an alleged tax fraud case at the Italian lender, a judicial source said.
docs.lead_paragraph: Italy's top appeals court has rejected an attempt to overthrow a verdict that last year acquitted former UniCredit head Alessandro Profumo and 19 other bank managers in an alleged tax fraud case at the Italian lender, a judicial source said.

headline.main: Italy Court Makes Acquittal Final in UniCredit Tax Fraud Case: Source
headline.print_headline: Italy Court Makes Acquittal Final in UniCredit Tax Fraud Case: Source

docs.snippet: A pivotal trial against McDonald's that began this week is providing a peek into the inner workings of the maker of the Big Mac.
docs.lead_paragraph: A pivotal trial against McDonald's that began this week is providing a peek into the inner workings of the maker of the Big Mac.

headline.main: McDonald's Trial Gives Peek at Chain's Inner Workings
headline.print_headline: McDonald's Trial Gives Peek at Chain's Inner Workings

docs.snippet: The Arab League labelled Shi'ite Muslim Hezbollah a terrorist organisation on Friday, Egyptian state media said, as tensions rise between Sunni and Shi'ite powers across the Middle East.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Arab League labelled Shi'ite Muslim Hezbollah a terrorist organisation on Friday, Egyptian state media said, as tensions rise between Sunni and Shi'ite powers across the Middle East.

headline.main: Arab League Labels Hezbollah Terrorist Organisation
headline.print_headline: Arab League Labels Hezbollah Terrorist Organisation

docs.snippet: A group of former Skype technologists, backed by the co-founder of the messaging platform, has introduced a new version of its own messaging service that promises end-to-end encryption for all conversations, including by video.
docs.lead_paragraph: A group of former Skype technologists, backed by the co-founder of the messaging platform, has introduced a new version of its own messaging service that promises end-to-end encryption for all conversations, including by video.

headline.main: Skype Co-Founder Launches Ultra-Private Messaging, With Video
headline.print_headline: Skype Co-Founder Launches Ultra-Private Messaging, With Video
